subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Aerobics Revolution
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Aerobics Revolution usable.

hook.text: In 1968, Dr. Kenneth Cooper published a book called 'Aerobics.' The word didn't exist before him.

buildup.text: Cooper argued that cardiovascular exercise â€” running, swimming, cycling â€” was the key to disease prevention.

discovery.text: Jane Fonda's 1982 workout video sold 17 million copies. Aerobics became a cultural phenomenon.

twist.text: The aerobics craze overemphasized cardio and ignored strength training. A generation built endurance but lost muscle.

climax.text: Today, the pendulum has swung. Strength training is now equally valued â€” a correction decades in the making.

punchline.text: One book coined a word. One video made it culture. Balance took 40 years.

quiz.question: What was a major drawback of the aerobics movement?
options: It overemphasized cardio while ignoring strength training
It was too focused on weightlifting
